title: California Fires: State Efforts to Prevent More Wildfires Complicated by Strong Winds
text:
Strong winds are expected to continue in Southern California, complicating efforts to contain a 745-acre blaze, as the threat of new wildfires rattles a state already on edge.

Firefighters were responding early Wednesday to a fast-spreading brush fire in the Simi Valley area, northwest of Los Angeles. The fire, located near the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library, prompted mandatory evacuations in the immediate area. Sparked just after 6 a.m., the Easy Fire grew to 407 acres within two hours amid gusty winds and dry conditions....
description: Strong winds are expected to continue in Southern California, complicating efforts to contain a 650-acre blaze, as the threat of new wildfires rattles a state already on edge.
